measured_by: neuronal activity in median preoptic nucleus (genetic-labelled / optogenetic)
justification: “Genetic labelling can be used to identify neurons in the median preoptic nucleus of hypothalamus that become active when a mouse is thirsty, and optogenetic stimulation of these neurons provokes drinking behaviour even in hydrated mice [27].”

measured_by: BOLD signal in medial orbitofrontal cortex (OFC)
justification: “Brain activity in the medial OFC tracked the level of accumulated resources (or ‘wealth’) over the context (Fig. 3). This ‘value accumulation’ signal occurred even though the accumulated rewards were never overtly signalled to participants.”

measured_by: BOLD signal in ventromedial prefrontal cortex (vmPFC)
justification: “BOLD signals in the ventromedial prefrontal cortex (vmPFC) encoded the cumulative expected value of assets across the block (Fig. 3).”

measured_by: BOLD signal in dorsal anterior cingulate cortex (dACC)
justification: “BOLD signals in the ventromedial prefrontal cortex (vmPFC) scaled with the expected future return … whereas dACC coded for the aspiration point itself (Fig. 3).”
construct: aspiration point / goal distance / risk pressure

measured_by: BOLD signal in ventromedial prefrontal cortex (vmPFC)
justification: “BOLD signals in the vmPFC signalled the level of redress incurred by a choice—the extent to which a choice brought the numbers of animals into equilibrium.”

measured_by: baseline neuronal firing rates across multiple brain regions
justification: “Using large-scale recording methods … every region tested … contained a substantial fraction of neurons that responded to thirst levels in the baseline period before a cue for water delivery was presented [28].”
